standard_metadata.standard_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.

hints.content: $\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{0.0}&\\ {0.35}&\overline{\Big)3.045} \end{array}$

$\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{0.0}&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)304.5} \end{array}$  Let's start by multiplying both divisor and the dividend by $100$. [[☃ explanation 1]]  We get the same digits moved $2$ places to the left of the decimal point.
$\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{0}.\phantom{0}&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)304.5} \end{array}$  Now we write the decimal point in the quotient.
$\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{0}.\phantom{0}&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)\blue{3}04.5} \end{array}$  How many times does $35$ go into $\blueE3$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{0}.\phantom{0}&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)\blue{304}.5} \end{array}$  $35$ is larger than $3$ and $30$, so let's look at $304$ instead.  How many times does $35$ go into $\blue{304}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &\orange{8}.\phantom{0}&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)\blue{304}.5}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{280}\phantom{.0}\\ &\pink{24\phantom{.0}} \end{array}$  $\blue{304} \div 35 = \orange{8}$ with a remainder of $\pink{24}$.

$\begin{array}{rr} &8.\phantom{0}&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)304.5}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{280}\phantom{.}{\downarrow}\\ &\blue{24\phantom{.}5} \end{array}$  How many times does $35$ go into $\blue{245}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &8.\orange{7}&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)304.5}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{280}\phantom{.0}\\ &\blue{24\phantom{.}5}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{24\phantom{.}5}\\ &\phantom{0.}0 \end{array}$  $\blue{245} \div 35 = \orange{7}$, with no remainder.

$\begin{array}{rr} &8.7&\\ {35}&\overline{\Big)304.5}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{280}\phantom{.0}\\ &24\phantom{.}5\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{24\phantom{.}5}\\ &\phantom{0.}0 \end{array}$  There are no more digits to bring down, and the remainder is $0$. So the quotient is exactly $8.7$.
